findings: The feature consistently activates at gene boundaries, particularly at the end of one gene and the beginning of another. title: Bacterial Gene Boundary Detector
description: This feature detects the transition points between adjacent genes in bacterial genomes. It consistently activates at intergenic boundaries with sharp, well-defined spikes that mark the precise location where one gene ends and another begins. The feature appears to recognize sequence characteristics typical of bacterial gene junctions, such as terminators, promoters, or other regulatory elements that occur in these regions. The pattern is remarkably consistent across diverse bacterial phyla (including α-proteobacteria, Firmicutes, Bacteroidetes, Actinobacteria, and Mollicutes), suggesting it captures a fundamental property of bacterial genome organization rather than taxon-specific elements. This feature may be detecting signals related to transcription termination and initiation, ribosome binding sites, or other regulatory motifs that define gene boundaries in bacteria.
